It is made of cast zinc and painted with a nice thick coating of black paint. I was shocked at how heavy and rugged this license plate bracket is. This is what you need on your car or truck so it will hold up in bad weather. The camera features 8 IR LEDs to help light your way even in the darkest night so you can see in the daytime or nighttime. Don't forget you also have your backup lights and taillights to help push away the darkness.The camera is a color camera and it has a 170 degree side to side viewing angle which is very good and it also has a 120 degree vertical viewing angle. Two set screws hold the camera in place and if you loosen them you can adjust the camera height to get the best viewing angle for the height of your vehicle. There is a supplied Allen wrench to loosen and tighten these screws. The video image has an electronic grid image on the video you see. It is made up of lines that are drawn in a trapezoid shape that indicates the distance to objects behind your car. Each grid line represents about 3 feet.The license plate camera is rated to IP67 which means it is submersible to 1 meter (3 feet of water) for about one hour without damaging the unit. The unit comes with a wiring harness that allows you to connect it to the rear back up light power wiring so the camera is only on when you are backing up. It also has an RCA type video jack cable (20 feet long) and after you wire the harness to your monitor wiring then wrap the jack with electrical tape to securely hold it plugged in and to keep the connection dry.The unit comes with a brief instruction manual and it shows the basic wiring to wire this up. It is nice that the cables that plug into the license plate holder already have connectors installed and they are color coded. (Please see my video) I rate this item as a 5 star product. There are less expensive backup cameras out there but they do not compare to the quality of this one!I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation and I promised to provide a fair and honest review.

Reviews.Title: TaoTronics TT-CC17 Camera
Reviews.Author: Robb
Reviews.Content: So I have to say that I'm surprised with the quality of this item. I could have gotten a cheaper costing cam for my rear plate but wanted a solid metal plate ring. It blends in well with the truck and works great so far. I would recommend this and already have. Waterproof, night vision, solid, looks good and reasonable price. I paired it with a 4.3" monitor and a 25' high quality video cable and created a very solid and stable backup camera system for less then $75. I do have to say that I soldered the reverse light connection and ground connection and took my time following the factory harness up to the front of the truck. I also drilled thru the plate with a 3/4" bit and put a rubber grommet on the plate to protect the wires. I then drilled thru the plastic under the plate with a 3/4" bit. This lets the video and power connection go straight out the back of the camera. No wires are visible when you look at the camera and plate ring. I installed this on a 2012 Ford F150 XLT Screw. I have been using it for about a week now in FL and it has been rained on like I can't even tell you. No ill effects yet...........Time will tell. Good luck and I hope this helps.Robb

Reviews.Title: Decent picture but could be better overall
Reviews.Author: Cohiba
Reviews.Content: The picture this license plate camera provides is decent, not great. It didn't include any hex head bolts; the license plate frame has hex head provisions in it so as to make it more secure.  Also, the wires from your splice point to the camera were so tiny as to be difficult to work with.  The connection they provide from the license plate to the monitor was good quality and decent length.  I've used the Boyo License plate camera in the past and it included all good quality components, had better picture quality, included black hex head bolts but it was three times the price.  So, for the money this isn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: Integration of TaoTronics TT-CC17 with Magellan 1700LM GPS
Reviews.Author: Shadow
Reviews.Content: To start off with this review is actually of two products, the Magellan 1700LM with back up camera and TaoTronics TT-CL17 back-up Camera.I have a 2010 F150 and because of it's size I decided to get a back up camera.  As I was in need of a new GPS I looked around for combination units.  These are pretty much limited to Garmin, Magellan and 4UCAM (Generic Model).  The Garmin is significantly more expensive than the Magellan but does have some additional features such as Bluetooth (Which I had no need for)Pros on the 1700Very nice big screen with good resolutionGood mounting system with integration of the wireless receiver for the back up cameraSimple menus, thought limited features, for GPS functionSimple to use PC software for system and map updatesAll cables etc. are includedVery good wireless transmitter and receiver.Switches automatically to camera mode when you put vehicle in reverse.Lifetime Map updatesCons with 1700The downloaded manual does not reflect the latest version of the software, some screens are differentThe back up camera is not very good, no grid lines and it is not infrared so it is useless at night.This brings me to the TaoTronics ($49.99) camera.  After doing some additional research I decided to try a different camera to see if I could improve the night visibility.  Even thought the TaoTronincs is designed for a hard wired use it works flawlessly with the Magellan wireless transmitter and receiver.  The only "custom" things you need to do is hard wire the 12 Volt directly to the camera and obtain a female/female RCA connecter for the video feed. You may want to purchase a shorter video cable as the supplied one is very long.Pros on TaoTronicsGood gridlinesVery good resolutionHas built in infrared LED bulbs for night vision.Looks pretty good for a license plate cameraAppears to be of excellent quality.Cons on TaoTronicsNone I can think ofInstallation on the F150 was very easy and involved no more than removing the taillight assembly (outlined in the Ford owners manual), running the camera wires from the camera to the video transmitter, wiring  the 12 volt to you back up lights, securing the wiring beneath the vehicle with some tie wraps, and reassembling.  It took me 30 minutes including adjusting the camera.  I also built a mount for the GPS screen out of PVC pipe fittings which mounts in the center console cup holder.  The total cost for this was ~ $10  at Home Depot.A couple of suggestionsWhile you have the tail light out install an LED back up bulb (921) they are way brighter than the stock bulb.  Instead of taping over the cable connections use heat shrink as it is more durable and water resistant.In summary the 1700 with the TaTronics camera is a pretty nice solution for a reasonable priced GPS/Back up camera combo.

Reviews.Title: TaoTronics® TT-CC17 Waterproof
Reviews.Author: adi
Reviews.Content: Camera is OK, definitely not a great image. I could barely recognize my own driveway. I guess you can't expect more for the money. Manufacturer had contacted me after I posted my review in November and promised to replace their product, once updated. Update is expected to happen in December. My review will follow.Review update 1: It is almost end of January and image quality worsened after the three month of use, I am still waiting to be contacted by manufacturer.Review update 2: I received the camera replacement, it is not updated version but manufacturer is trying to resolve the issue. Image quality improved substantially.Good customer service!

Reviews.Title: very pleased, much better than expected
Reviews.Author: A Holmes
Reviews.Content: Has held up very well so far.  Seems very sturdy, the frame is actually made from steel! Only 2 complaints.  All green colors are pink, not a big deal.  Also, like everyone else has mentioned, the ground and power wires are ridiculously small, and difficult to splice.  I think mine yanked free 4 times before i got it good.  Its been installed 3 months for far, i've used its almost daily on my F150, bouncing up and down back roads, the camera has held up fine.  Unparalleled customer service.  I was called 2 months after my purchase, following up to see if i was happy with the product.  The lady was pleasant, and even reminded me of the one year warranty, in case I wanted to return it based on the green-pink thing.  I wired mine hot when the key is on, wasn't easy running a wire all the way up into the cab through the current wiring harness, but i managed.

Reviews.Title: It works.
Reviews.Author: Paul Tsotsos
Reviews.Content: I used with the TaoTronics 4" monitor I  mounted in a Honda 20002 CRV. My only complaint is that the power and ground wires are too small a gauge and difficult to make a secure connection with the power and ground in the car. I put a pin male connector on the ends and matted with a female connected (soldered) to a 18 gauge wire that runs to the backup lights. Because the licence plate is offset the guidelines do not give an accurate idea of where the sides of the car are.  I contacted their support and got a quick response that the grid lines are set in cmos so can not be changed. My solution to the problem as to  print  side guide lines on a overhead projector media and tapped to the monitor to give an idea where the sides of the car are.The night vision works ok at night. I have only had for a few weeks but it works fine so far.

Reviews.Title: I Luv This Camera !!
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy "mossbackman2"
Reviews.Content: It mounts easily in place of my old license plate frame and friends are amazed when I point out thats its a camera. It's been thru a couple of heavy downpours and still works fine.The supplied wiring was more than long enough to make it to the front of my Chevy Colorado Crew Cab.The image is stable even when I'm driving( I wired mine to stay on all of the time unless I turn it off with the monitor switch)It delivers a nice color image to the monitor in daylight and a black and white image in dim light. It was more work to istall a hard wired camera than a wireless one but I think the image is better with a hard wired camera. Since I have a shell and carpet on my truck bed I simply ran the wire along the truck bed and up to thru the sliding window. I then put duct tape on top for the entire length to protect it. I then ran it behind and under the rear seat to about 5 inches before you could see it from above, cut a hole in the carpet and used a fish tape to run it under the carpet to the front. No drilling required and a nice looking install.

Reviews.Title: works good
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I installed it on my truck with a Magellan 9955 Lm wireless due to the old one craped out on me after a year (from Magellan) took the chance and it worked fine the IR lights for night no difference looks nice it is metal nice and heavy

Reviews.Title: Solid Build
Reviews.Author: Michael Peterson
Reviews.Content: 1) this has a very solid build quality! and 2) yes, it works well at night! It is a pretty heavy frame, the picture quality is pretty nice if you're not expecting Blue Ray images. The integrated green to red lines in the picture help when estimating distance, and after a while will have you parking an inch away from the garage door without a problem. The picture at night is great and it's almost a bright as day. I adjusted my camera so I can see the top of my bumper at the bottom of the picture.The viewing area is very large and you can see everything behind you for a long way!  It's about the best balance of quality and price that I saw when researching add-on cameras. I have it coming through my Pioneer touch screen and It is powered by my reverse lights, so it only turns on when I through it in reverse.  Alternatively, you can wire it to a switch in order to turn it on while driving if you want to monitor your trailer, etc. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: Stealth back up camera produces fine image
Reviews.Author: R. P. Sanford
Reviews.Content: The camera is really nice and produces a very good image to more than 50 feet behind the car. Unobtrusive and doesn't require drilling any holes. I did put some extra silicon around the edges of the unit just to make sure it stayed waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Buy this!
Reviews.Author: Her$H
Reviews.Content: This is a awesome back up camera I thought the license plate might look cheesy but it fit my 2004 Toyota 4runner perfectly, the quality of the video is great I am very very pleased!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! for this price you will not find a better camera!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Hernandez "Jonathan"
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this camera/plate combo I thought it would be plastic  I was happy when I found out that it was in fact metal the quality of the camera is very clear in day/night in the night camera resorts to black and white while in the daytime it is in color  the lens is adjustable if you need to adjust it. I have amazon prime ordered this item on a sat morning and was suprised to see my package a day early on mon will order again from seller

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Moe betta DMV
Reviews.Content: Simple installation, It works day and nite, solid construction, sturdy, well worth the money, priceless for those with large trucks or vehicles where parallel or back in parking may be difficult...

Reviews.Title: good product.
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: Worked as advertised. I am happy with it so far. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because video cable wasn't long enough for my truck.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera vision
Reviews.Author: JUAN
Reviews.Content: very nice vision and the display is very good. the plate is strong. I like the rear view camera. I recomend it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! I can see everything
Reviews.Author: djluski
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my monster truck. This camera provides an excellent view, about 170 degrees. The best part is the lines it projects so you can tell your proximity with whats behind you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Stucktruckin
Reviews.Content: I paired this with a mirror-mounted monitor but was unable to see it in bright daylight. I replaced the monitor with a 5" dash mounted monitor and the picture is absolutely perfect. There is NO delay in activation when shifting into reverse and the warning lines really help. With the camera angled at its lowest setting I can see things only a foot or two behind my car and yet still see the horizon as well.

Reviews.Title: solid, quality camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This a nice heavy metal frame that mounted easily on my license plate and still allowed month/ year registration stickers to be seen. I have it hooked up with a wireless setup as it is on a pickup truck, but it has done well in recent snow, icing, road salts, heavy rain and mud. I would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: MKov
Reviews.Content: I ordered this based on the numerous positive reviews.  I haven't installed it yet, but it is solid metal construction.  I can't wait to hook it up to my Garmin.  The screw holes are designed for a recessed hex head.  You will need 6M bolts and access to the rear to use recessed bolts & nuts on the backside.  If you don't have access to the back side of the bolts, you will need smaller screws that will rotate within the recess.  Home Depot or Lowes will have the hardware you need.I read one review that said the supplied video cable was too short.  My kit came with 20', so that should be long enough for my '05 Dodge 2500 longbed truck.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, especially for the price. The picture is mostly clear and it seems to hold up very well. The night vision works pretty well too. Much better quality than the cheaper versions out there. I've been in a few bad storms, including snow and hail, and it still works just fine. The only thing that could make it better would be a little clearer picture but, overall the picture is much better than the cheap ones i have purchased within the last year. Other than that it's perfect. Definitely recommend to buy this item.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Nice sturdy product, clear picture, would have been nice if the video cord was a little longer to accommodate full-size trucks.

Reviews.Title: Best for un $50
Reviews.Author: Jamrs
Reviews.Content: I purchase a number of cameras for fleet vehicle and I gave this a try. I worked perfect. I love the heavy duty construction. I will be ordering more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, IR Backup Camera
Reviews.Author: Russell Lekberg "R. Lekberg"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on many different backup cameras, from dirt cheap to high-end.  What I wanted was a camera that worked well in day and night and would allow me to position the camera centered on my hitch so I could hook up my trailers on my own with ease.  Job done.  Installed this in late fall and I haven't had a problem in cold, wet, snowy weather yet.  Wipe the snow off the bumper and go.  The IR works great and gives good distance and a nice wide view as well.  For this price, even if this thing goes out in a couple of years, I'll probably buy the same one again.

Reviews.Title: good picture!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Zanni "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for one of my plowing trucks since there are so many variables when plowing the blind spots are horrible to my surprise it was of great quality so if your looking for that fix for a backup camera this one will work! dont forget no monitor comes with it so either buy one separate or if you have a large display on your radio it will work.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, awesome, awesome!
Reviews.Author: Billy Nubz
Reviews.Content: I installed this on my 2014 Scion FR-S Monogram Edition, using the BCSU3 wiring harness from Beat-Sonic and the picture is so clear and the grid-lines are really useful.

Reviews.Title: Great price and good product..
Reviews.Author: VellsMaster
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my F150 with a camper shell since it had a huge blind spot for backing up.  Bought this along with the Tao Tronics CM04 7 inch LCD screen.Got it installed in Best Buy for $100 (well worth the money).You can either set it up to be on all the time or turn on only when you switch the gear to Reverse (While not in reverse, the display powers off, which is a nice feature).  It has two video inputs, apparently 2nd input could be connected to a DVD player or a second video camera.I have a Tesla Model S and a Nissan Leaf.  The camera in Tesla is of course top notch, with great day time picture quality.  Leaf is a bit mediocre.  But the night vision in Tao tronics camera is great compared to both my other cars.  But daylight camera quality is so so.. not sure if it is the display or the camera, but the colors seem to be off a bit.  But for purposes of backing up, it is quite functional and adequate.I'm happy with the purchase overall and will recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: usmc9196
Reviews.Content: Shipping: Received quickly and well packed.Installation: The instructions were kind of poor, so I got the information I needed online. The included cables were long enough for my car (2007 Dodge Charger). Since the camera housing blocked out my license plate light, I unscrewed the camera housing, turned the frame (not the camera) upside down and then re-attached the camera to the license plate frame and then put it on the car. So the camera is at the bottom of the license plate and my license plate is still illuminated at night.Quality: In the past week since it was installed, it has rained hard, hail storm and snow. My car was outside for all of it and I haven't had any problems with water or condensation in the camera yet.Picture: It is a decent picture that allows you to see behind you. It is not an HD TV and I did not expect it to be. The colors are normal except that black on clothing looks purple.All in all, it went in easy and does as advertised. I was not counting on flipping the frame upside down but it still functions like it is supposed to and looks "normal."I would buy this again if one were needed.

Reviews.Title: Fire Truck Approved
Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: I installed these cameras on three of our brush truck units, and they work impeccably. The tough construction holds up to the demand of our rough country wild fires, and the picture quality is excellent! I like the fact that you can angle the len so that you get the best angle. Works great at night too, plenty bright for viewing behind you. Safety is our number one priority, and we use these cameras in our trucks because they work!

Reviews.Title: Great backup camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: rotwiler
Reviews.Content: Overall for the price this is a nice backup camera, I installed this camera in my 2010 camaro ss and works great. I  have a kenwood ddx896 and works perfect. In daylight the camera is color and at night black and white like all night cameras are, the night infrared less work great and can see as far as anyone would need to on a camera. I put 5 stars but If I had the option 4.5 would be my rating due to the backup lines on the screen are not as wide as I would like and video is a little distorted in shape, but this is a excellent camera for the money and the frame is well built. You may need a little extra wire to reach, I used a rca connector to add on some length, but smaller vehicles would be fine(I was 3 foot short).

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL L
Reviews.Content: I installed mine on a 2006 Toyota Tacoma, using a Pioneer 3600 head unit (screen).  Instead of using the head units reverse camera option, I soldered a cigerette lighter plug on the cab end and will be plugging and unplugging via my cigertte power/aux power in the cab and of course the video cable to the back of the head unit.  After installing everything yesterday this option works flawless, I wanted to use the camera when I wanted not just when in reverse and I didn't want to tap into the factory wiring.  The clearity of the camera is better then what I was expecting, even in the DARK!  I am extreamly happy with the way this project came out, the quality of the frame and camera is second to none.  If your looking at a back up camera system and you already have a screen, this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice.
Reviews.Author: Leedogg
Reviews.Content: Just installed this on my 07 Avalanche with a Pioneer AVH-X5600.  Works as advertised(Havent used at night yet).  Seems to be pretty well built.  For the money- I think it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Shawna Brown
Reviews.Content: It was a few days late getting to me, but I ordered it right before some bad weather hit. It is working great! My boyfriend has and F350, so he had to find some more cord to make it long enough to reach. It fit right over the licence plate, he bought some bolts and nuts so it is flush against the frame.

Reviews.Title: Happy indeed!!!!
Reviews.Author: arnice
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this product to anyone it is a great product the color display is great the camera is accurate it rain the second day after I had it installed and there is no water standing in the camera like some cameras have I'm happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Heavy Duty Looks Good
Reviews.Author: Warsign
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid product.  It mounted perfectly and the video display is very clear day or night.  Well worth the price if you are in need of a backup camera.  Video cable was 3 Ft too short for my double cab tundra, so plan on an extension if you have extended cab truck.

Reviews.Title: Automatically display when in reverse.
Reviews.Author: Gary Snodgrass
Reviews.Content: The camera  feels solid and looks very nice. I hooked the wire up to the reverse lamp on  the tailgate assembly on the driver side then the video cable to the cd player. The only problem I had was the rear camera did not automatically display on my monitor when in reverse like the instructions said it would. I had to buy an extra wire 16 gauge stranded wire to hook up on my cd player reverse line to my reverse lamp on my taillight assembly on the passenger side. The wire was not included or mention in the instructions or product details.

Reviews.Title: This is the one you want
Reviews.Author: gisboro
Reviews.Content: This installed in about 30 minutes, with no problems at all. It has a crisp and clear picture, guide lines to help you judge the distance and the waterproofing really works, I have been through a few high pressure car washes and everything is still working as it should. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Lifted Truck
Reviews.Author: DEERHUNTER30
Reviews.Content: I searched for several days looking for the best camera system for my F150. I read several reviews and studied each aspect of every camera system on the market.  Let me begin by saying I have had this camera system for three months and continue to be very satisfied.  I have a lifted 2012 F150 with 35" tires and this camera performs perfectly.As far as the durability,  I have not one complaint.  It has had snow, ice, rain, mud, and other things (I'm a hunter) on it.  It has performed to perfection without one flaw.  The image is very clear and comes with distance bars installed within the image.I have bought 2 more cameras since my initial purchase and gave them as birthday gifts.The install took about an hour simply because it was my first time working with electronics like this.  My next one took 30-45 min.For a camera at a price listed ...I'm 100% satisfied I made the right decision.  So continue to read other reviews and study like I did....or stop wasting your time and take it from me....This camera system is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty well
Reviews.Author: N. Suarez-skeen
Reviews.Content: This camera gets the job done.  There are times when it rains that it is hard to see, but im sure other cameras are the same way.  I would buy again if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Ethan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to install to my daughter's vehicle.  It works great....the camera is high quality and puts out a good picture....even at night.  I would highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: good purchase
Reviews.Author: Julie Gerace
Reviews.Content: This is a solid unit with good clarity.  The housing is sturdy, adjustment of the camera is simple with a supplied allen wrench.  I installed this in a 2006 Mazda 5 with JVC head unit.  Night vision is good, daytime is very clear.  The camera does have a tendency to get dirty quickly, but that's expected in the Northeast during winter.  The picture does get a bit washed out when there is TOO much light behind you, but not a show stopper by any means.  I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the price for this backup camera.Installation was fairly easy and required running the video cable all the way back. Another wire was run back so that my deck would automatically switch to the camera when it was placed in reverse. (only con as this was not provided)I'm happy with the image quality that it produces, even at night.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mario Flores
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 2004 Ford F150 which has a 6" lift because we have kids and so my wife can now safely back up with confidence. I saved about $140 purchasing this from Amazon and by doing the install myself. the running of the wires from the back of the truck took some time because you need to route two wires (AV & Remote) all the way to the stereo carefully as not to interfere with any moving/cinch parts or points that may cut or stress the wires, and then zip tie everything into place. You also need to wire it into the reverse lamp on the tail light. I used solder and heat shrink tubes to make sure it would not short out if it touched any metal and would by waterproof. After I ran the AV cord to the stereo and the other wire to the reverse tail light, I had to run a third wire to the reverse signal wire coming from the stereo to the reverse light in my other tail light to make the camera picture come on when putting it into reverse. I could have tried to find the wire in the cab to make the connection however since I already ran and hooked up the other wire (from the plate camera) to the tail light, and I had already routed and figured out how to make the connection it was easy to hook up the wire to the other reverse light. All in all the camera has a better picture than my wife's 2009 Chrysler Town and Country Limited minivan and works great.

Reviews.Title: Great but for the money.
Reviews.Author: rick crist
Reviews.Content: This is a really good product, i would recommend it to anyone. Easy to install only took about a hour with finding power and ground and hooking it to the car deck. The camera itself has really good picture and is easy to adjust. Seems like its pretty rigid and made well. My wife drives a SUV and didn't think she needed it(hasn't seen herself backing up) and now she loves it.Great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Gutierrez "copcar340"
Reviews.Content: Hooked it up to Pioneer Head unit and it works great so far. Clean, Clear picture. RCA cord is kinda thin but long enough to reach the licence plate from my dash.

Reviews.Title: It works, it's adjustable and it's sturdy.
Reviews.Author: Ughmahedhurtz
Reviews.Content: Aside from that, it is low resolution and has a FOV of about 100 degrees. Whoever said 170 was on crack or meth when they wrote the description. I'm not returning it as it does actually work at night and accomplishes what I wanted but 170 degrees? Really, y'all?

Reviews.Title: Good product, but I need more parts for my car
Reviews.Author: V. Rosu
Reviews.Content: Sturdy construction, good picture, good angle, I like the grid lines.Cons:-The wire that goes from the camera to the inside of the trunk/trunk lid, has connectors that are too large; this requires drilling a 1/2" hole; they should provide smaller jacks for the video and power wires.-for my car (Audi A4 2006) the power supplied by the reverse light *when the engine is running* is noisy and renders the picture distorted or completely black. If the engine is off, the picture is perfect. I read up on Audi and WV forums and apparently is because of the power to the reverse light. I'll need some power smoothing component or wiring it up to some other source.-The size if the camera is good, but again for my car I needed a bit more work as the button for trunk release is right above the license plate and the camera was in the way. I ended up ripping the plate support from where it was and installing it about an inch lower to clear the trunk release.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!!
Reviews.Author: BionicRain "Buddha"
Reviews.Content: This is seriously all that you need for you reverse camera. Thee exact same similar product would cost you at least $150 + $150 installation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Perfect mounting solution, but picture not as good as an OEM camera
Reviews.Author: Katy Katie
Reviews.Content: I used this on a 2006 F150 and Kenwood DNX6190HD.  It looks good, and mounting is nice and neat and tidy.  The picture however, is not quite as clear as you would find on OEM cameras.  I would buy again though.

Reviews.Title: sturdy
Reviews.Author: David W Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: Much more substantial than expected all metal thick non bending frame.  All the wiring was included.  The bolts are not included

Reviews.Title: Excellent bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: J. Cupit "Gadget Leet"
Reviews.Content: I installed this camera along with the $20 3.5inch LCD monitor(also on Amazon) on my 2011 Ford F150.  Took about three hours and the results are fantastic.  I wired the power connectors into the reverse taillight and ran the video cable up to the engine compartment and then into the interior of truck.  I did have to put in a small video cable extension to join the monitor video IN cable but that was an easy pickup at local WalMart.  The camera wires where of a decent gauge and I had no issue stripping or soldering the wires to the truck wires.The video is clear enough and the grid lines help gauge distance (yellow is about 1ft. away on my truck).  Has helped immensely with parking my largish truck on a busy street where parallel parking is a normal daily routine.  The whole system for less than $90 where I easily see other systems for $300-$800.

Reviews.Title: Extremely good value.
Reviews.Author: H. Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera was easy to install and the night vision is better than a $200 camera I had on another vehicle. The daytime vision lacks sharp color and appears a little over exposed, but for $49 this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture with Infrared
Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because of its waterproof capability and the infrared feature.  The infrared feature turns night into daylight.  The picture is clear.  The camera came with 17 ft of RCA cable which was long enough to reach all the way to the dash in my Ford F250 supercab.  Very pleased with the camera so far.

Reviews.Title: Solid. Nice image! Good night operation!
Reviews.Author: T. Neimi
Reviews.Content: This is the first backup camera I've used.  I'm completely happy with the sturdiness of the frame of this model and the signal cable length was just right for an 01 Durango. I went ahead and wrapped all the exposed length with electrical tape to add protection from the elements and abrasion where I tie wrapped it to the frame.  Yes, it took a whole ten minutes to do.  I wrapped and protected the power and signal connections at the mount, too, and put a bead of silicone sealant around the wire coming from the camera as that seemed like it could be vulnerable over time.I'll update this if it fails to meet my expectations over the next year here in the Rocky Mountains.So far, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Looks great and works well
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I really like the quality and look of this product especially on my LX470 since it has chrome trim around the back anyways and this matches it perfectly.  Installation was very easy to do myself, but like others stated the wires you use to hook up to the rear backup light are way too thin.  I bought a titanium cone shaped drill bit from Pepboys to drill the hole for the wires and it worked great without chipping or messing up the surrounding paint.  Install didn't take long and the SVideo cable was long enough for my large SUV.  Hardest part was finding the right wire near the head unit to splice to trigger the head unit to know when the car was in reverse.  Finally found a posting that described the correct wire which was right behind the glove box.  Used my multimeter and found it on the second try.  Spliced it easily enough and it worked as advertised.  Other than the super tiny wires mentioned above I was a little disappointed with the angle of viewing as the Lexus LX470 has an inset area for the License plate and therefore makes you adjust the camera angle a little lower than I would have liked.  Regardless, I like that it lets you angle it to your desired setting with a small allen wrench included to loosen/tighten the angle.  Looks factory installed though once in place.  If you are looking at the $15 backup camera's like I was and you have a high end car that already has chrome trim around the rear of the car you def should cough up the $50 bucks.  I did see it cheaper on another site so could have saved a few bucks if I wanted too, but I like/trust Amazon so just got it here.  Def worth the extra $$$!

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: PROs- Price is nice and cheap yet- it gives a color video feed- IR for night-time vision- guidance lines, to include distance markers so you can get nice and close to the vehicles in a parking lot- Wide field of view, Not 180 degrees but it is better than a 3x4 standard pic tube view of whats behind youCons- Cheap cheap wires, so thin and fragile you'll have to solder the wires to your power source or it will not work.  Trust me, Just solder the 5 itty bitty strains of wire to your reverse light wire or which ever you decide to tap into to get your power from. (crimp wire will not work)- video will flicker from time to time while reversing but overall, what can you expect from an IR camera under $40.00

Reviews.Title: Best decision I've made
Reviews.Author: Kendrick Lomax
Reviews.Content: I must say, this reverse camera has not only changed and improved my way of parallel parking in Chicago but it is also very VERY clear even at night. I paired it up with that screen they show with it in the photos and it works marvelously! I mounted the screen to c-pillar on the back of my 93 escort hatch (highly recommended) so when I turn around to back up I can see both my surroundings and a detailed view of exactly where my back bumper will touch. Everything turns on as soon as I put the car in reverse and I have never seen it skip or jump. Very clear even at night. Haven't tried it in the brutal winter yet but the brutal summer has been just fine! I highly recommend this camera. Oh and incase anyone is wondering (because I know I was) yes the camera lense is adjustable for up and down. My escort rear license mount has a slight tilt upwards so if the camera were fixed I would have a serious problem. But the camera comes with an Allen wrench so you can loosen it to manually adjust the camera how you want it then without disturbance of your choice tighten it so it doesn't move, BRILLIANT! And if anyone is worried about quality, this plate frame is very heavy metal and so is the camera casing. It is built very tough. Mine got wet once, blurred the camera a bit, I got out and wiped it off, it was fine after that. Just that simple and seems very, very durable. The only thing that makes me nervous is that the wire running behind the camera, unless you plan to drill a hole or have a hole just behind the frame itself, the wire will get squished between the frame and your mounting surface. Leaving me wondering if that will eventually eat through the wire and short out. Other wise I freaking love it!

Reviews.Title: Impressive Image - Some configuration required
Reviews.Author: Majo2469
Reviews.Content: What I love about this camera most is that it says in the manual "do not attempt to install this if you are not experienced with this kind of installation". As soon as you ignore that, it's pretty straight forward. It gives a good grid that you can configure by adjusting the angle of the camera. Does well in low light, and in water. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: Well Priced, nice looking, backup camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrew D. Keener
Reviews.Content: I had ordered a wireless backup camera first, thinking it was going to be easy. Well it turned out bad with so much interference that I couldn't even use it. I ordered this one for 50 bucks and its working great so far. I ended up hooking this to a second relay switch so I could control the camera with a remote. Running the power wires and video cable to the back of the truck took the longest time. I used either black electrical tape or shrink tubing on all exposed wires including the video connectors and power connector. I also used exterior, clear silicone sealant around all cracks and open sections of the camera housing to ensure no water could creep into the camera. This camera also really looks great on my truck. Its extra work but you save cash and get a great picture.

Reviews.Title: pretty cool
Reviews.Author: jose ramirez
Reviews.Content: works fine. great buy. and if you have a good indash to go along with it, then you will really like it

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: T. Neeley
Reviews.Content: Looks good on the truck.  Heavy duty frame; solid construction. Extra long cable, reached from the plate to the front of my 2010 Chevy Traverse.CCD performs well in sunlight, a little less so using the night IR illuminated functions.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Rocky Polster
Reviews.Content: connection wires are VERY thin, which makes a good connection slightly more difficult, but the camera works well. No problems with moisture oranything yet, even after multiple washes.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Jacob C. Fletcher "SFC Fletcher"
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price works great.  Only issue I noticed was the other night when it was like 15 degrees but the next day it worked just fine when it warmed up.

Reviews.Title: Rear view plate camera
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I was not happy that the product did not show up as expected but it is in the process of being installed, the plate frame the camera is mounted on seems to be made out of quailty material.

Reviews.Title: Rearview License Plate Camera
Reviews.Author: Take my Word on it.
Reviews.Content: This camera is installed on my classic showcar, and I absolutely love this unit. I have the unit wired in so it's constantly hot, and i can monitor was happening at anypoint instead of using it as a reverse camera only. Hope this note helps

Reviews.Title: Quality camerae
Reviews.Author: JCB "JCB"
Reviews.Content: A quality camera and smart integrated design. I'm happy I went with this option versus a separate camera you add to a license plate. Also, less likely to be stolen or torn off.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: EK Cali Girl
Reviews.Content: This camera works seamlessly with your current vehicle old or new. Love being able to see in color what's behind me.

Reviews.Title: Why not
Reviews.Author: Crzywhtby
Reviews.Content: I like the camera it works well and comes in handy. Don't be a cheap a** and buy the cheapest one you can get. Get this one well worth it. Only reason for four stars is the RCA cable came up short. But I have a ex cab long box truck so I just bought a connector and 3 ft  RCA cable problem solved.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: J. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Product is ok imo. The construction of both the frame and camera is sturdy. This is my first car back up camera so I don't really know what other model are like, but the view from my Pioneer AVH-P3400BH is ok (I can see the image clearly in the day and a good 15ft+ or so at night). There is always room for improvement such as resolution but that also mean I have to upgrade my car stereo. We'll see how long this will last. I work in the telecom wireless field and I drive alot (dirt road, pavement, cold and hot weather). I'll update my review if it will hold up.Edit: 4/2/13I install this on a Suzuki Kizashi 2012 and I drive it off road alot and my car has dark tint windows all around so I needed a camera system that I can see where I backed up to. This camera delivered in total darkness (with a tail lights on obviously). It helped me navigate backing up through hard corners, around brushes, rocks, and trees. No water have gotten through the lens yet and manage well in foggy weather. I don't I should do off road on a sedan, but that's what I got and that's what I drive.Whatever you do, don't trust any backup camera as your main eyes because they're not calibrate to be 100% on every vehicle. For the price and quality, I think it's totally worth with.

Reviews.Title: High quality camera kit
Reviews.Author: 350z
Reviews.Content: Camera works great both day & night. You can position the camera right where you need it. I have used the power sprayer at the car wash several times, and I have sprayed it lightly each time. I never see any water leakage or misting of the camera. In rain it obviously has no problems staying clear. As a CMOS camera, typically they are only meant to be wired into the reverse light circuit. They usually get hot after to long of being powered on and start to get cloudy from heat build up. This CMOS camera actually holds up rather well under continued usage. I installed security bolts from the local auto parts store and there is no way you can get this thing off without ripping out your license plate bolt retainers & half of your bumper. Overall the best camera kit on amazon I have came across.

Reviews.Title: A great addition to my truck
Reviews.Author: E.C. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for your backup camera needs.  The housing and frame are metal, and feel very sturdy.  The image is clear even at night.  It also looks very nice on my truck.  It doesn't stick out visually.  Blends right into my bumper.  I had to contact the company for a customer service need, and was happy with our exchanges.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! It costs a little more than others, but it is solid and has been through many heavy rains and car washes without a single problem.  The guide lines shown on the screen are just that, GUIDE lines. I use this on my crew cab f350, and they are a little narrow for the width of my truck, but thats to be expected with a universal fit product.  They do, however, aid when hooking up to my camper, helping me to see where the exact center of the screen is. Its nice that the camera can be adjusted up or down to get just the right angle. At night the camera does a decent job with the built in infrared.  I live outside the city so night time is pitch black and the infrared allows me to see about 20-30 feet max, which i feel is acceptable.  The directions it comes with aren't the best, but that's okay, It's not rocket science putting one of these things in. I soldered the wires from the camera to my reverse lights for a more permanent and professional installation which was harder than expected due to the tiny guage wires from the camera.  The video cable that comes with the camera is BARELY long enough to be used on my f350 crew cab with an 8 ft bed. An extra foot or two would have made the install much easier. The cable seems to be of decent quality though.  Overall, I am very happy with this camera.  It costs more than others, but you get what you pay for in this case. I would definitely buy another if i ever needed to.

Reviews.Title: love the back up camera
Reviews.Author: Sergiy Titarchuk
Reviews.Content: Bought it half year ago. Has no issues at all. Have other car with original installed back up camera and this one has better picture.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Carlson
Reviews.Content: This thing is awesome. Great during the day and even better at night. The built in grid lines are a nice touch. The only bad thing is that the power wires are pretty small and hard to work with. Also I put this in a crew cab F250 and the supplied video cable was not long enough but I was expecting that.

Reviews.Title: poor quality product
Reviews.Author: Jeff Newton
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a low cost alternative to the $200 Pioneer camera sold with my new Pioneer receiver.  Installed this at the same time that I was installing the new receiver. Ultimately spent half the weekend trying to figure out why I had such a poor image and ended up bringing out a TV from the house to connect directly to this camera to be sure that it wasn't the monitor on the new receiver. The image was so dim as to be unusable.  The  original product was a camera integrated into the license plate frame which was definitely more attractive than the camera that I ended up purchasing (for twice the price). At the time that I checked on an exchange or a refund, the refund was the only option. Since I had my vehicle torn apart, I purchased a new camera locally to finish the job.  The seller contacted me later, apologized and offered to make an exchange to make it right, too late in my case.  While I was unhappy with the product in this instance, I appreciated the follow up, and I would be willing to do business with this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Looked good, but didn't fit!
Reviews.Author: James T. Davenport
Reviews.Content: Product appeared well made etc but simply was about 1/2" oversize to fit into the recess provided for the license plate on my car.

Reviews.Title: since october 2012
Reviews.Author: Gee 35
Reviews.Content: This fit perfectly on ny 04 g35 coupe c; , with aftermarket radio system of course .(I have pinoeer radio app 2)You can c what's behind you at night + +

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: tks
Reviews.Content: It is very good has good picture & nice angle Just wish a monitor was included  no big deal bought one thatthat is 4x3''

Reviews.Title: Rear-view
Reviews.Author: Steven Bryant
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, and functional camera.  Very clear picture in the daylight. At night the picture becomes black & white and the picture is still a good quality.  Instructions are very vague and should be re-written but still well worth the money.  Wise buy!

Reviews.Title: Just perfect!
Reviews.Author: witchyhour
Reviews.Content: I got this camera when I purchased a Chevy Equinox and was worried about running into things behind it, since it's a taller vehicle. I was surprised with the price, it was much cheaper than I expected this sort of thing to be. And I loved the fact that it fits around the license plate, so there was no need to try to find a spot for it.The camera was installed in conjunction with the Pioneer AVH-P3400BH 2-DIN Multimedia DVD Receiver with 5.8" Widescreen Touch Panel Display, Built-In Bluetooth®, and HD Radio stereo and it is fantastic. The image is very clear, day or night. This camera was exactly what I wanted, and I am very happy with it.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Works and is very well made
Reviews.Author: Larry S. Holtzen "sblardog"
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the quality, all metal construction. Had professionals at Best Buy install it and they did a great job! Could be a little wider view, and the distance scale accuracy needs to be a little more accurate, i.e. when you hot the RED danger zone I still had about 20+ inches to spare, which may NOT be a bad thing. There is no manual adjustments for this available, at least that I could find. I would test it yourself to become familiar with how the REAL scale works for your vehicle. Great camera quality, great price and well built. Definitely a good buy!

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong!!
Reviews.Author: Jcompo
Reviews.Content: This is amazing especially for the money. The only thing I would reccomend is buying a higher quality video cable. however I did use the cable it comes with and so far no complaints. It's quality heavy metal construction far exceeded what I was expecting for the price. The video quality is as good as any vehicle that comes with a rear camera from the factory. I notice a lot of people mention the power and ground wires are too small but it's not a problem I think they may be using the wrong connectors or not know how to solder and shrink wrap.

Reviews.Title: Works But !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Wayne J. Valzania "HouseWhispererCT"
Reviews.Content: This will be a fairly brief review because all this camera needs to do is to mount well and provide a clear image to the monitor. As mentioned in other reviews, the frame is quite rugged and mounts easily. Connection is also straightforward with the provided 25' RCA cable. I have this camera plugged in to a Rear View Safety Inc.7" LCD Color Backup Camera System with Audiowhich I also bought through Amazon. The camera that came with the Rear View Safety unit is quite clear and is therefor my point of comparison. The TaoTronics camera on the other hand, is noticeably out of focus for the entire center of the image. In fairness, I'm not sure if it's just my unit but I'm not looking forward to the process of replacing it and just wanted to toss this review out there for your consideration.

Reviews.Title: Sunvalleytech TaoTronics Tt-Cc17.
Reviews.Author: Clifton  P  Harper  Jr

The item itself in well made and and performs perfectly.  If you are familiar with automotive wiring and have basic mechanical skills you can install this item without too much trouble.  Conclusion, camera and frame 5 stars directions 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Needs Some Minor Design Improvements
Reviews.Author: Mike "I Run, I Bike, I Wrench"
Reviews.Content: Recently installed this camera.  The wiring was straightforward as was the mounting.  The camera quality and view angle are great for the price.  The frame is very rugged and the camera easy to adjust.I think the recessed parts for the mounting screws should be round, not hex.  That would allow most plate mounting screw heads to fall into the recess and eliminate the need for longer screws.  There also needs to be a better way to route the wire from the camera.  The license plate can cut into the wire if you are not careful.  I needed to cut a notch into the back of the frame for the wire.  Cutting the notch allowed the frame to sit flush against the body of the car.  The frame is aluminum so filing a notch was easy.Overall, a good product that needs some minor tweaks for the next design iteration.

Reviews.Content: I got this camera to install with a Boyo rearview mirror dealie, but it should work with anything that has a composite video input (yellow RCA cable) Installed pretty easily, had a good long video cable and it reached up to the drivers side underdash on a 2007 Dodge RAM Megacab/short bed.
